sentences.sContent: Lou lifted the box easily, without using much effort.
sentences.sCn: 卢没费多大力气就把箱子搬了起来。

sentences.sContent: Frank put a lot of effort into the party.
sentences.sCn: 弗兰克办这次聚会花了不少精力。

sentences.sContent: Learning to speak another language takes effort.
...the sound relationship between two generations requires the integration of numerous measures derived from the joint effort of parents...
...I will make more effort to repay your kindness and refresh our family affection...
...giving your full attention to the speaker and making an effort to shift the focus of the conversation to the other person...
...What we are suggesting is that a population-wide effort to reduce salt intake...
...I keep mentioning how much effort it takes to keep going...
...we find that it is long years of will and constant effort that have brought about their success...
...It seems that your effort has paid off...
...Only a tiny fraction of Americans change any behaviors in an effort to preserve their privacy...
...everyone in this society contributes some effort to the improvement of the environment...

phrases.pCn: 不遗余力；抽出；宽容；节省
尽力而为，尽最大努力；尽力服务
团队合作，团队努力的结果
对某事付出极大的力气

words.tran: 需要努力的；显示努力的；充满努力的

trans.tranOther: the physical or mental energy that is needed to do something
